description.raw:
1) The solver/timestepper divide has been reorganized to accomodate non-multistep methods.  The remaining variable-step-size multistep IMEX schemes from Wang 2008 have been implemented, along with a few IMEX Runge-Kutta methods from Ascher 1997.

2) Operators wrapping many numpy unary ufuncs, and generic function/arg sets, have been added.

3) Writing through h5py has been modified to use the low-level interface so that collective calls can be issued for data, including subspace data.

4) Several convenience functions have been added for the parallelized post-processing of hdf5 datasets.

5) A DictionaryHandler has been added based on the CalculationHandler from Daniel's branch, which is convenient for e.g. cfl calculations.

6) The existing FFTW transform wrappers have incorporated into the bases/distributor.  Using FFTW transforms is now a config option, default True.

7) Config options have also been added for scipy.linalg.sparse.spsolve options.

8) A simple, optional, length-1 cache has been added for saving operator outputs.  It's enabled by default just for integrate and interpolate operators, to try to balance memory consumption vs. performance.
description.html:
1) The solver/timestepper divide has been reorganized to accomodate non-multistep methods. The remaining variable-step-size multistep IMEX schemes from Wang 2008 have been implemented, along with a few IMEX Runge-Kutta methods from Ascher 1997.

2) Operators wrapping many numpy unary ufuncs, and generic function/arg sets, have been added.

3) Writing through h5py has been modified to use the low-level interface so that collective calls can be issued for data, including subspace data.

4) Several convenience functions have been added for the parallelized post-processing of hdf5 datasets.

5) A DictionaryHandler has been added based on the CalculationHandler from Daniel's branch, which is convenient for e.g. cfl calculations.

6) The existing FFTW transform wrappers have incorporated into the bases/distributor. Using FFTW transforms is now a config option, default True.

7) Config options have also been added for scipy.linalg.sparse.spsolve options.

8) A simple, optional, length-1 cache has been added for saving operator outputs. It's enabled by default just for integrate and interpolate operators, to try to balance memory consumption vs. performance.

title.raw: Expanded timesteppers, low-level h5py, FFTW transforms
